text: You are certainly are entitled to voice your opinion. But, frankly, you couldnt be further from the truth. Trade/invest well.

And when a guest is asked about bonds - and says something like (as Dr. Jeremy Siegel said on Thursday on @cnbc), they are only yielding 2.5% v. 7% inflation (-4.5% return) -- why not ask them well, if you owned the S&P this year you lost -10% v -7% inflation ...
for a real total return loss of -17%! @ScottWapnerCNBC @SquawkCNBC @FoxBusiness @business @SullyCNBC @SquawkCNBC @threadreaderapp unroll

Before I leave for meetings - and I ask this respectfully .... Why does Fin TV spend more than 95% of its time interviewing guests who employ a long-only strategy and who are, by definition, perennially bullish? @SullyCNBC @SquawkCNBC @business @FoxBusiness @ScottWapnerCNBC
